result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel D. Bartle

records.addlTxt: 1:38 PM Defendant Daniel D. Bartle in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Daniel D. Bartle.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set per scheduling order.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:56 AM Defendant Daniel D. Bartle in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Joshua Grube. Defendant to reimburse the County $30 per month.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No contact directly or indirectly with victim L.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May have one time visit with police escort to collect personal belongings.

3:11 PM Defendant Daniel D. Bartle appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Daniel D. Bartle.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim L.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May have one time visit with police escort to collect personal belongings.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
